answers.answer: I had the same problem went into the er Sunday as well as a pulse double what it regularly is. I was severely dehydrated. After 2 1/2 IVs it went back to normal. It could also be gestational hypertension which is high bp only during pregnancy
Sometimes when you eat salty foods it can make your blood pressure rise. But I think most of the time your body is stressed because of all the extra work its doing. But I could be wrong.
Is that common in the last trimester? The gestational hypertension? I'm almost 37w
with my first pregnancy my blood pressure was fine the whole time. it spiked up to dangerous levels during labor and I had to be put on an IV and oxygen. it really can happen at any time.

I had a problem with high blood pressure between weeks 18-23 with this pregnancy. I had been super sick and was scared I was going to get dehydrated (had a stomach bug that WOULD NOT go away) so I was drinking powerade/Gatorade a lot. It never caused a problem before. Well after the third high reading doc said that I may have a problem so I started looking at my diet. Nothing had changed except the powerade/Gatorade, so I stopped drinking them and within that next week my BP was back down to 115-130  over 50-60. (Those drinks are high in sodium because they are made for athletes that sweat alot to keep them from being dehydrated and week) My perfect numbers. So if anything has changed, might want to cut it out and see if it helps!

question: At my appointment today my blood pressure was very high, no protein in my urine but dr drew blood to make sure nothing is wrong. I should get results tomorrow. My question is, aside from stress and being in pain, what could have caused my blood pressure to be that high? I was in a good mood and not in any severe pain so it rules those out. Thanks in advanced!
title: Preeclampsia?
